meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of pyromania.
meanings.sent1: Her pyromaniacal behavior was concerning to her family.
meanings.sent2: The detective suspected the arsonist had pyromaniacal tendencies.
meanings.sent3: The pyromaniacal cat knocked over a candle and caused chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: His pyromaniacal obsession with matches was like a dangerous dance with flames.
meanings.sent5: The pyromaniacal glow of the bonfire lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: Inclined to start fires for pleasure.
meanings.sent1: The pyromaniacal child loved watching things burn.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter knew how to distinguish between accidental fires and pyromaniacal ones.
meanings.sent3: The pyromaniacal squirrel accidentally set fire to its own nest while playing with matches.
meanings.sent4: Her pyromaniacal joy in setting ablaze small objects was a cause for concern.
meanings.sent5: The pyromaniacal joy in his eyes as he lit the fireworks was unmistakable.

meanings.definition: Showing an abnormal fascination with fire.
meanings.sent1: The pyromaniacal student was always found near the school's incinerator.
meanings.sent2: The pyromaniacal individual had a collection of lighters and matches.
meanings.sent3: The pyromaniacal artist painted fiery scenes in every artwork.
meanings.sent4: Her pyromaniacal gaze lingered on the flickering flames of the candle.
meanings.sent5: The pyromaniacal intensity in his eyes when he spoke about fire was unsettling.
